Currently, the "Use Step Filters" toggle is always enabled. We could disable 
the action when a selected target does not support the feature (i.e. does not 
implement IStepFilters).

Fixed. The action is disabled when a selected element is from a debug target 
that does not support step filters. When there is no selection, the action is 
enabled, as the toggle should be available in general (i.e. is not selection 
dependent). The disablement is simply to show that the feature is not 
available for a specific selection.
Please verify, Darin (S). Changes in ToggleStepFiltersActionDelegate.

This isn't working quite as documented in this bug.

If the user selects the launch of a debugtarget the "Step filters" button will 
be enabled even when the debugtarget under the launch doesn't support step 
with filters.  In this case the debugtarget does implement IStepFilters and 
returns false but the code in ToggleStepFiltersActionDelegate 
assumes "enabled" for anything except selections that implement IStepFilters.

I agree with one of the comments in this bug that says it should be enabled if 
nothing is selected.

Should I re-open this bug or create a new one.  I would like the toggle 
delegate to get the debugtarget of a launch to make selecting any item related 
to a debugtarget consistent.
